result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:38 PM Defendant Daniel D. Meneau in court.  Attorney Marconi DeFranca Barros appears for Jacalyn Christie Labre for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Raymond Bilka in court for Daniel D. Meneau.  Inducement made.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: John Bilka, through Public Defender.

3:47 PM Defendant Daniel D. Meneau appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
The Public Defender has yet to find an attorney to represent the defendant. The court informs the defendant that he could apply for a court appointed attorney. 
The defendant wishes to wait for a Public Defender to be appointed. The Court finds cause to toll time limits in which a preliminary hearing must be held. 
The bail modification will be heard once an attorney is appointed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter requesting bail modification
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Daniel D. Meneau appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Public defender needs more time to appoint counsel.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Court tolls time limits. 
Preliminary hearing reset to 05-16-2022 at 3:45pm.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

2:18 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel D. Meneau appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Luke Harrison in court along for defendant.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Prints to MTSO.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on arrest-bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 4-18-2022 at 1:30pm in Br. 1.  Bail is set at $5,000 cash bond with the conditions that the defendant maintain absolute sobriety and is not to possess any controlled substances. Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody. Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTSO.
Arrest-Bench warrant with service of officer thereon. 
Minutes.
Initial appearance on April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
